005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter.MetaschemaDataTypeProvider;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CollectionUtil;
010
011import java.util.LinkedList;
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock;
014import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017
018/**
019 * A base implementation of an {@link IDataTypeProvider}, supporting dynamic
020 * loading of Metaschema data type extensions at runtime.
021 * <p>
022 * The {@link MetaschemaDataTypeProvider} class provides an example of how to
023 * use this class to provide new data types.
024 */
025public abstract class AbstractDataTypeProvider implements IDataTypeProvider {
026  @NonNull
027  private final List<IDataTypeAdapter<?>> library = new LinkedList<>();
028  @NonNull
029  protected final Lock instanceLock = new ReentrantLock();
030
031  @Override
032  public List<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>> getJavaTypeAdapters() {
033    try {
034      instanceLock.lock();
035      return CollectionUtil.unmodifiableList(library);
036    } finally {
037      instanceLock.unlock();
038    }
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Register the provided {@code adapter} with the type system.
043   *
044   * @param adapter
045   *          the adapter to register
046   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
047   *           if another type adapter has no name
048   */
049  protected void registerDatatype(@NonNull IDataTypeAdapter<?> adapter) {
050    if (adapter.getNames().isEmpty()) {
051      throw new IllegalArgumentException("The adapter has no name: " + adapter.getClass().getName());
052    }
053    try {
054      instanceLock.lock();
055      library.add(adapter);
056    } finally {
057      instanceLock.unlock();
058    }
059  }
060}
